DOC.detailed_description: Pragmatic , multicenter , 2x2 factorial randomize study . Severe patient admit ICU moderate high risk death acute kidney injury randomly allocate receive balance crystalloid solution ( Plasma-Lyte® ) 0.9 % saline receive crystalloids rapid bolus infusion ( 999 mL/h ) slow infusion ( 333 mL/h ) whenever plasma expansion need .
DOC.criteria: Inclusion Criteria ( three ) : 1 . Need plasma expansion , clinician considers PlasmaLyte® 0.9 % saline equally appropriate patient , specific indication contraindication fluid rapid slow infusion . 2 . Patients expect discharged day admission . 3 . At least one follow risk factor acute renal injury : 1 . Age ≥ 65 year 2 . Hypotension ( mean arterial pressure [ MAP ] < 65 mmHg systolic blood pressure [ SBP ] < 90 mmHg ) use vasopressor 3 . Sepsis 4 . Use invasive mechanical ventilation continuous noninvasive mechanical ventilation ( include highflow nasal cannula ) > 12 hour 5 . Oliguria ( < 0.5 mL/kg/hour ≥ 3 hour ) 6 . Serum creatinine ≥ 1.2 mg/dL woman ≥ 1.4 mg/dL men 7 . Liver cirrhosis acute liver failure Exclusion Criteria ( ) : 1 . Age < 18 year 2 . Acute renal failure treat renal replacement therapy ( RRT ) expect require RRT within next 6 hour 3 . Severe hyponatremia ( serum sodium ≤ 120 mmol/L ) 4 . Severe hypernatremia ( serum sodium ≥ 160 mmol/L ) 5 . Hyperkalemia ( serum potassium ≥ 5.5 mmol/L ) 6 . Death consider imminent inevitable within 24 hour 7 .
